meanings.definition: The quality, condition, or fact of being exact and accurate.
meanings.sent1: Her precision in solving math problems impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The watchmaker's precision in crafting tiny gears was remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The chef's precision in cutting vegetables made them look like colorful jewels.
meanings.sent4: His precision in timing the jump made him win the race by a hair.
meanings.sent5: The surgeon's precision with the scalpel saved the patient's life.

meanings.definition: The degree to which repeated measurements show the same result.
meanings.sent1: The scientist's experiment showed high precision in its results.
meanings.sent2: The precision of the scale ensured accurate readings every time.
meanings.sent3: The precision of the clock was so perfect that it never lost a second.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the compass guided them safely through the dense forest.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the ruler helped in drawing straight lines without errors.
